title: BBC Local Live: Leeds and West Yorkshire on Friday 5 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: nineteen-year-old man injured in meanwood shooting .
huddersfield town chief executive nigel clibbens leaves club .
chitty chitty bang bang breaks playhouse box office record .
investment deal could boost £ 116m east leeds ring road plan .

documents.title: goodbye : our live coverage across the day
text: well , it 's goodbye from him and it 's oh actually it 's just goodbye from me .
that 's all from our live coverage for the day , but we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 .
we do check our emails , so if you do spot something you think we should talk about , why not email us ?
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: more news from west yorkshire : coming up on look north
text: coming up on look north tonight from 18:30 on bbc one
a new campaign 's being launched to promote yorkshire as a centre of excellence for financial services .
the hope is to attract more international firms to set up in the region .
and the new exhibition at the bronte parsonage museum .
it compares charlotte 's love of all things tiny - to her huge literary ambition .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: demolition crews bring down gable end of fire-ravaged drummond mill
text: one of the large gable ends left standing at the fire-ravaged drummond mill in bradford was pulled down today .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: video : teenager shot in leg in leeds 'was targeted '
text: a rush-hour gun attack on a teenager in leeds is thought to have been a targeted incident following a fall-out between rival groups .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: weather : sorry , but it 's looking like a wet weekend ahead
text: rain will slowly spread this evening , some heavy spells and squally winds .
rain clearing later and the strong winds falling light .
it will turn colder later too .
lows around 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow rain will return northwards .
a cloudy day with spells of rain at times , heavy in places .
the winds strengthening and becoming gusty later .
a maximum temperature of 10c ( 50f )
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: grants of up to £ 100,000 available for flood-hit businesses
text: grants of up to £ 100,000 are to be made available to support business in west yorkshire hit by flooding over christmas .
the west yorkshire combined authority has agreed a total business flood recovery fund of £ 5m .
it said grants could include cash to repair or buy new equipment , pay to restore flood-hit premises or help with relocation costs .
the money will come from the areas regional growth fund allocation from the government for 2016/17..
it is believed around 2,000 businesses were damaged by the flooding in december .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds

documents.title: leeds bradford airport in world war two
text: some great here from @ twitterid lba during the war years and the factory producing bombers .
# leeds # bradford # airport # war # history # old
@ twitterid hi , really like the of lba and the lancs , can we use them on our live feed ?
@ twitterid hey !
feel free to use any of the we share .
we have taken some of them , but a lot of the old ones we find online/archives
@ twitterid great stuff , thanks very much !

documents.title: travel update : m62 westbound j27 lane closed
text: let 's hope they get this shifted pretty quickly , it 's getting dangerously close to rush hour .
there 's one lane closed and queuing traffic on m62 westbound between j27 ( m621 gildersome ) and j26 , ( m606 chain bar ) , because of debris on the road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lumb lane businesses open after mill blaze
text: earlier today , i was on lumb lane in bradford , the site of the devastating blaze at drummond mills .
the fire has left the building as a shell , and now business owners are warning that they need people to come back to the area , and bring their trade with them , now the road has re-opened .
author: Charles Heslett
Journalist, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: travel update : a660 headingley closed both ways
text: on the a660 otley road in headingley , the road is closed in both directions at the b6157 shaw lane junction , because of an accident involving three cars .
causing a lot of problems on all routes in the surrounding area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: chitty chitty bang bang , leeds loves you !
text: the west yorkshire playhouse production of chitty chitty bang bang has broken the theatre 's box office records , taking £ 1.5m in ticket sales .
while it was on stage in leeds , 60,000 people saw the musical , which was the theatre 's biggest ever christmas show .
it will now go on tour for a year , playing 19 venues across the uk

documents.title: i bought an ice rink on ebay
text: would you buy an ice rink on ebay ?
one woman did and is now preparing to open the doors of halifax 's very own indoor ice skating rink this weekend .
author: Halifax Courier

documents.title: latest headlines : nineteen-year-old in hospital after shooting and chitty breaks box office records in leeds
text: the latest headlines in west yorkshire include :

documents.title: weather : cloudy afternoon ahead
text: a mostly cloudy afternoon with some brighter spells away from the hills and possibly some drizzle over the pennines .
a maximum temperature of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : new homes found for kellingley colliery cats
text: the last working animals from a british coal mine , four feral cats , have been rehomed by cats protection in york .
it 's after the closure of kellingley colliery .
one of them , florence , is named after a miner 's wife who marched with lines during the 1980s strike .
now she 's been given a new home at a family farm near york .

documents.title: proud bradford parents make it a hat-trick of twins
text: a bradford mother has astounded nurses and upset odds of 500,000:1 by giving birth to her third consecutive set of twins
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: photos of leeds residents dating back to 19th century on show
text: an exhibition of photos dating back to the 1830s is going on show from today at leeds city museum , it show generations of people who have worked or lived in the city .
among them are a collection of six antique portraits of former lord mayors of leeds , which are the oldest photos in the leeds museums and galleries collection .
changing faces of leeds features from 1836 to the present day .
more than 500 amateur photographers have sent in their snaps , a team at the museum then chose which ones should appear in the final display .

documents.title: watch : campaign to promote yorkshire as financial services centre of excellence
text: a new campaign to promote yorkshire as a centre of excellence for financial services is being launched today .
the idea is to attract more international firms to set up in the region .
potential investors will be encouraged to think of opening offices in the north instead of in london .

documents.title: huddersfield town chief executive leaves club
text: huddersfield town have confirmed that their chief executive nigel clibbens has left the club after seven years .
clibbens joined the club 's board in december 2008 .
he played a big role in helping the club progress off the field , as well as on the pitch through promotion back to the second tier .
he leaves with my best wishes for the future . ''

documents.title: latest headlines : mill fire traders are 'open for business ' and 19 year old in shot in leeds
text: the latest headlines in west yorkshire this morning include :

documents.title: hospital to get £ 16m boost
text: health bosses are preparing to invest £ 16m to redevelop fieldhead hospital in wakefield .
author: Wakefield Express

documents.title: farage appearance on question time thwarted by traffic
text: it has emerged that nigel farage failed to appear on the bbc one 's question time , which was filmed in bradford , last night because he was stuck in traffic on the a1 .
the ukip leader 's deputy , paul nuttall was left to stand in .
there were there were reports of an accident in nottinghamshire , which had closed all lanes on the northbound carriageway .
mr farage tweeted shortly after 8.30pm : `` now been at a standstill for 90 mins on the a1 .
bbcqt doubtful .
damn . ''

documents.title: appeal for help from traders after drummonds mill fire disruption
text: last week a fire ripped through the historic drummonds mill in bradford , more than 100 firefighters were at the scene and the plume of smoke could be seen for miles around .
the owners of local businesses on lumb lane could do nothing but watch .
well , traders there say they 're really keen to see their street opened to traffic .
they say support for small businesses is crucial to get the community back on track .

documents.title: update : nineteen-year-old shot in leg in meanwood attack
text: police have revealed more details of a shooting that happened in leeds yesterday evening .
officers were called to the scene at 17:30 but the suspects had left the area in a vehicle .
the 19-year-old had been shot in the leg , but his injuries are n't thought to be life-threatening .
police are currently carrying out high-visibility patrols in the area to re-assure local residents .

documents.title: people 's history of pop : 'i turned down offer from mark knopfler '
text: all this week we 've been bringing you stories of west yorkshire 's musical heritage , using people 's memorabilia .
dave johnson from leeds has no regrets about turning down mark knopfler , who asked him to head to london with him to `` make it '' .
how many copies of sultans of swing were sold again ?
author: Johnathan I'Anson
People's History of Pop

documents.title: super league : leeds rhinos 10-12 warrington wolves
text: leeds rhinos began the defence of their super league title with a narrow defeat by warrington wolves at headingley .
leeds were hindered a little with the loss of mcguire , but no excuses .
warrington found enough quality in their attack and we saw some sublime touches from sandow . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : giants coach on season opener
text: huddersfield giants coach paul anderson previews their super league opener tonight away at st helens .
you can hear full commentary of the match in 'west yorkshire sport ' tonight from 19:00 with me and phil veivers .
author: James Deighton
BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: deal hope for £ 116m leeds ring road
text: a ground-breaking deal could provide funds for a £ 100m-plus road construction scheme that would change the face of a huge swathe of leeds .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: latest headlines : mill fire business owners appeal to customers and workers at huddersfield chemical plant reassured
text: the latest headlines in west yorkshire this morning include :

documents.title: nineteen-year-old injured in headingley shooting
text: police are investigating a shooting in leeds yesterday evening .
a 19-year-old man is in hospital with non-life-threatening injuries after emergency services were called to a reports of a shooting in stainbeck road in headingley at around 5.30pm .
an investigation into what happened is under way .
the roads around the area remain shut .

documents.title: weather : cloudy and mild day ahead
text: generally a cloudy and mild day today .
patchy drizzle is possible but most places will be dry for much of the day perhaps even seeing some brighter spells at times .
afternoon highs around 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: travel update : m62 eastbound j26 accident
text: we have lots of queuing traffic and one lane closed on the m62 eastbound between j26 ( m606 chain bar ) and j27 , ( m621 gildersome ) , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : our live coverage today
text: it 's friday , so named because , in the old days , people would fry up all of their food they had after the week and have a huge feast .
this , of course , is complete rubbish - unlike the quality news , sport , weather and travel i shall be bringing you until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to send me anything , just email me
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Leeds
